ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la gɔɔn né Yelemî ngie: Cwóŋo nɔʼɔ fùɔ pà Yúndà ńtsẅii nò yɔɔn.
en: This is what the Lord says: “Go down to the palace of the king of Judah and announce this word there.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ge gɔɔn ngie: Gù fùɔ pà Yúndà gẅie à néŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ fùɔ Ndavîd, júʼu shwóŋè Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Ashwóŋè Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ŋwɛ́ líe gú; ńdíe pʉ̀a pie é tsẅé nɔʼ, ńdíe pʉ̀a láʼ pú pie é cʉa na mɔɔn mencwò nkáʼ.
en: You are to say, ‘Hear the word of the Lord, king of Judah, you who sit on the throne of David    #— #you, your officers, and your people who enter these gates.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi giŋ páʼ lepʉ̌ ne ńzɛ́te, ḿbiŋ ńzáʼ mentsaŋ páʼ á ne ńzɛ́te. Pi fó mbwó pʉ̀a pie é nɔʼɔ pʉ̀a, ńkẅé pʉ̀a pie mé ne ńnɔʼɔ wɔ́b. Tà pi lɔg tʉ̀ ńkú megʉ̀ lâ púɔ méntsě, mbɔɔ mepfɔ̌g. Tà pi pége wɔ́b. Pi pɔ́ɔn légíŋe ńzẅéte membǔʼ, á jʉʼɔɔn.
en: This is what the Lord says: Administer justice and righteousness.   Rescue the victim of robbery from his oppressor.  # 22:3 Dt 28:29; Ps 35:10; Ec 4:1; Jr 21:12 Don’t exploit or brutalize the resident alien, the fatherless, or the widow.  # 22:3 Dt 14:29; 24:17,19–21; 27:19; Ps 146:9; Jr 7:6; Ezk 22:7 Don’t shed innocent blood in this place.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńtÿɔ́gɔ kwò na yɔɔn shwóŋè, mbà mé ge ké láʼa gẅiin pɔ́ mefùɔ pie é ge néŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ fùɔ Ndavîd. Pɔ́ ké ńgíŋe ńdɔgɔ yɔ́b pɔ́ melÿóon kà mekélêg lÿóon wɔ́ɔ, ńgiŋe. Ḿbiŋe ńgíŋe ńcʉa yɔ́b pɔ́ na mencwò nkáʼ mɔɔn. Á wɔ́b; lâ meŋwǎláʼ mbɔɔ pʉ̀a láʼ.
en: For if you conscientiously carry out this word, then kings sitting on David’s throne will enter through the gates of this palace   riding on chariots and horses #— #they, their officers, and their people.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, pi lɔɔn ńké te zẅíʼte nò gie n gɔɔn wɔ́, mbà kwàʼ mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé, n kʉ̌a ngie anɔʼ yɔɔn ge láʼ cʉ́ʼ gwɔ́ pɔ́ tsẅɛʼɛ́ kʉ̀ŋe.
en: But if you do not obey these words, then I swear by myself    #— #this is the Lord’s declaration #— #that this house will become a ruin.’ ”  # 22:5 Jr 17:27

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa na nò nɔʼɔ fùɔ pà Yúndà,
en: For this is what the Lord says concerning the house of the king of Judah:

ngiemboon: N ge gÿo tóŋ pʉ̀a,
en: I will set apart destroyers   against you,

ngiemboon: «Megʉ̀ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ge gÿo cʉa ngʉ̀ŋe tÿǒsoŋ Yelúzálèm. É sele zɛ́te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Mélàʼakɔ́ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tɔ́ɔn yɔɔn ntí nò na wɔɔn máamáa tÿǒsoŋ?
en: “Many nations will pass by this city and ask one another, ‘Why did the Lord do such a thing to this great city? ’

ngiemboon: Mé tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Á tíi páʼ pʉ̀a pie é kɔ̌ɔn ńtsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn tÿǒsoŋ, pɔ́ la ŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́, á mvfò tsɔ́ messé, ńguʼte; ńdɔg ńzyɛ́ʼɛ kʉ̀a gie pâ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé yɔb, la gwá.»
en: They will answer, ‘Because they abandoned the covenant   of the Lord their God and bowed in worship to other gods and served them.’ ”  # 22:9 Dt 30:17

ngiemboon: Pa Yúndà, ndyɛ̀ʼ pi
en: Do not weep for the dead;

ngiemboon: Shÿalum gẅie aa míŋ Jÿosiyásè, ńgwɔ́ fùɔ pà Yúndà, la jÿó ndá tá we ńcʉ́ʼʉ fùɔ, ḿbiŋ éfó jʉʼɔɔn ńgʉa. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔ̌ɔn nò ńtí yé ngie: Ngwɔ́ á le láʼ ńgíŋe ḿbiŋ wɔ́.
en: For this is what the Lord says concerning Shallum   son of Josiah, king of Judah, who became king in place of his father Josiah, and who has left this place: “He will never return here again,

ngiemboon: À ge láʼ kwé pɔ́ jʉʼ gie mé la lɔgɔ yé ńgʉa né wó, à těen ńdáʼa ńgíŋe ńgyá ngwòŋ wé wɔ́.
en: but he will die in the place where they deported him, never seeing this land again.”

ngiemboon: Jÿohakim, yêe ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ gie ɔɔ tsoló le!
en: Woe for the one who builds his palace

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ne ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: who says, “I will build myself a massive palace,

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ lɔgɔ tÿǒ sɛ́ɛndèle ńnyɛte púʼu,
en: Are you a king because you excel in cedar?

ngiemboon: À lɔ̌ɔn ńtága nzèm mepóŋ,
en: He took up the case of the poor and needy;

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ńgʉa na gù,
en: But you have eyes and a heart for nothing

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn nò ńtí Jÿohakim gẅie aa míŋ Jÿosiyásè wembàŋa, ńgwɔ́ fùɔ pà Yúndà ngie:
en: Therefore, this is what the Lord says concerning Jehoiakim   son of Josiah, king of Judah:

ngiemboon: Mé ge láʼ túŋo yé pɔ́ páʼ mé túŋo nɔ̀ɔn la.
en: He will be buried like a donkey,

ngiemboon: «Pi pʉ̀a Yelúzálèm,
en: Go up to Lebanon and cry out;

ngiemboon: N da ne ńkága tuŋó gí,
en: I spoke to you when you were secure.

ngiemboon: Fèfà ge gÿo kaa mefùɔ pí ntsèm.
en: The wind will take charge of    all your shepherds,

ngiemboon: Pi pie pi kɔ̌ɔn ḿbʉ́le ńtsẅé
en: You residents of Lebanon,

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la gɔɔn mbwó Koniya gẅie aa míŋ Jÿohakim wembàŋa, ńgwɔ́ fùɔ pà Yúndà ngie: «Páʼ n ge láʼa gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó la, n kʉ̌a ngie: Á lɔɔn ńzɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie ɔ̀ kaa mbwó mèŋ, ńgwɔ́ páʼ cÿɔʼɔ́liŋé yɔ́ɔn gie á kaa na pwó yɔ́ɔn yetʉ̀, mbà n ge fó mǒ, é soŋ, é gwáʼ.
en: “As I live” #— #this is the Lord’s declaration #— #“though you, Coniah  ,# 22:24 2Kg 24:6–17; Jr 37:1; 52:31 son of Jehoiakim, the king of Judah, were a signet ring  # 22:24 Gn 38:18; 1Kg 21:8; Hg 2:23 on my right hand, I would tear you from it.

ngiemboon: É sẅéen gú, é náa mbwó pʉ̀a pie é ne faʼa lézẅé gú. Á mbwó pʉ̀a pie é ne maʼa cÿɔʼ na gù. N gɔɔn páʼɔɔn á mbwó Nambukondonozɔɔ gẅie aa fùɔ Mbambilonia, pâ palÿɔ́ʼncù pé.
en: In fact, I will hand you over to those you dread,   who intend to take your life, to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and the Chaldeans.

ngiemboon: N ge gÿo jwoŋo gẅí lâ memá pi, é náa tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ ndyɛ̀ʼɛ, é ngwòŋ gẅie mé la te gẅí wó zyé. Pi ge láʼ kwéte pɔ́ wó.
en: I will hurl you and the mother who gave birth   to you into another land,  # 22:26 2Kg 24:8 where neither of you were born, and there you will both die.

ngiemboon: Pi ge gÿo pú sáʼ tʉ̀, é tsɔ́ɔn lépiŋ nzèm táʼ, pi le kuʼu lépiŋ nzèm wɔ́.»
en: They will never return to the land they long to return to.”

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a zɛ́te ngie: «Tsye Koniya wɔɔn, aa páʼa mbà à kéen ńcʉ́ʼʉ mmó gie ńgwɔ́ mé le zẅɛ́ʼ ka? Á mmó gie ńgwɔ́ á le kẅéte ka? Ńtí kɔ́ mé ka jwoŋo yé lâ gubé yé, ńnáa tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie pɔ́ te ne ńzsé wɔ́?»
en: Is this man Coniah a despised, shattered pot,

ngiemboon: Ngwòŋ wég! Ngwòŋ wég! Zẅíʼte shwóŋè Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: Earth, earth, earth,

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔ̌ɔn ngie pɔ́ ŋweʼe ńtí Koniya ngie: «Andÿò wɔɔn ŋwɛ́, à gwɔ̌ pɔ́ te múɔ. À ka te gÿo tsɔ́ mmó tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó wɔ́. Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ na tsìŋendá yé, à těen ńdáʼa ńnéŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ Ndavîd, é sáʼa ngwòŋ Yúndà wɔ́.»
en: This is what the Lord says:
